title: I am a US Citizen having issues getting a passport.
question: Never had a passport before but already applied for 1. I have been required to send additonal info such as employers, residences, family info, etc. I do not understand why I'm being asked to send all of this information including some that I do not see how it is relevant in order to get a passport. Seems like they issued one a while ago even when apparently I failed to establish my identity in a satisfactorily manner. Are there any cases of US Citizens who were denied a passport? Is this even possible?

We need a bit of clarification - you first say you never had a passport before, but later say they issued one to before even without all this documentation. Are you saying they earlier issued one to someone else in your name? That you actually did have one before, but a while ago? A bit confused here.

Assuming this is the first one you've applied for, I still need to know more about the application - what did you send in? If the original documentation of citizenship - birth certificate or otherwise - gave them reason to inquire (looked fraudulent or something along those lines), they may want further evidence of citizenship status over a period of time.

I'm also confused because normally, for a first passport, they make you appear in person rather than just mail in the application.

I don't know personally of U.S. citizens who were permanently denied passports - any problem I've ever dealt with involving an actual, bona fide U.S. citizen has been solved by additional documentation, even if the Department of State refused at some point to issue a passport..
